metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value: PAGE TWO-A   ROOMS SOUGHT  FOR OFFICERS  Home  Owners Urged  to  Rent A Avaiable Unoccupied Quarters  plans for a campaign to get  Charleston home owners to rent  a avaiable unoccupied rooms to  army and navy officers stationed in  this area were announced today by  T. J. Kenny, chairman of the chamber of commerce central housing  committee.  "Numerous officers assigned here  are being faced with difficult rooming problems," Mr. Kenny said.  "They cannot make use of any of  the housing projects here, and are  unable to find rooms.  "We are calling upon the people  of Charleston to aid this wartime  situation by opening their homes  to these officers and renting a  possible rooms that are now unoccupied to them," he said.  Mr. Kenny, Capt. James B. Byrne  of the port of embarkation, ieut.  D. T. Eiman, sixth nava district  civiian personne officer, Area Rent  Director James J. Ataian and ieut.  [jg] Huger S. King will meet with  representatives of the Junior League  of Charleston this afternoon to enist the support of that organization  in the campaign.  Other women"s organizations will  be caed upon soon to aid in the  drive,  Mr. Kenny said.  The housing committee is also  working on plans for a remodeing  campaign to get househoders to remode homes, wherever possibe, to  provide Additional rooms for officers and war workers in Charleston.  Members of the committee are:  Capt. A. B. Reed of the Charleston  Shipbuiding and Drydock complany, Co. John E. Eare of the port  of embarkation, Captain Byrne,  ieutenant Eiman, ieutenant  [jg] King, Austin Busby, Edward  D. Cement and Paul W. Conant.
